alert.note: Alert for Central and Southeast Phillips; Garfield; Petroleum; Southwest Phillips (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 4:55PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Phillips, Petroleum and southwestern Garfield Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 455 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles southwest of Zortman to 13 miles southeast of Mosby. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Winnett, Zortman, Sand Springs, Fourchette, U L Bend Rec Area, Crooked Creek Rec Area, Devils Creek Rec Area, Edwards, Mosby, Phillips, Petrolia Lake, Fred Robinson Bridge, Steve Fork, Landusky and Cat Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central and Southeast Phillips; Garfield; Petroleum; Southwest Phillips
